result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. McCann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sexual Assault of Child by Person Who Works or Volunteers with Children

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment in an occupation approved by agent.

Defendant shall not work in an occupation where there is contact with minors.

Comply with rules and requested assessments by agent and follow through with treatment recommended.

No romantic relationship with any adult female while on probation unless agent approves.

No unsupervised contact with any minors.

Submit DNA sample; not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall comply with sex offender treatment if any within 55 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim CLH until the victim is age 18.  Once the victim has turned age 18 she may file a waiver of the no contact in writing with the diversion coordinator, if the defendant's probation allows him to have contact with the victim and the waiver is filed he may have contact with her.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim's family.

Defendant shall have no contact with any person age 17 or less unless supervised.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if the defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with C.L.H. dob: 5-22-1998, including her residence, work or family.

Comply with sex offender registry program.

Undergo sex offender assessment and comply with treatment recommended.

No unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18 unless approved by agent and then only in the presence of a DOC approved chaperone.

No romantic relationship with females 18 or older unless agent approves.

Not be in a position of authority, either in a paid or volunteer position.

Comply with all programming, recommendations and rules per agent.

Defendant allowed to have contact with his children; the no contact with minors does not extend to defendant's own children.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain/maintain employment in an occupation approved by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
